content.description: Start standing on the right side of the clean face of the upper boulder on a couple of decent edges. The pedestal boulder in on for feet. Traverse left using some good slots and sloping edges to gain the left arete, then climb arete to the top.Â
content.protection: There is a decent-sized block that could come into your landing zone if you barndoored off the arete. You might want a few pads for this one.
content.location: It is on the right hand side of the Top Heavy Boulder.

content.description: Start sitting just to the right of the lichen on the bottom boulder. Move left to the arete, then work your way up the arete eventually using some slots on the right face of the boulder. Pull the lip whenever you feel fit, I felt waiting till you are right around the middle of the right face was the most natural.
content.location: Start on the left side of the Top Heavy Boulder.

content.description: Start sitting under the dagger-like block above. With hands on a good ledge of the bottom boulder, use what feet you can reach to pull on and transition into sidepull/undercling/jug like feature on the overhanging boulder. Use this to reach a nice long edge on the face of the dagger. Power up to the diagonal crack above, and top out.
content.protection: A few pads for the somewhat rocky landing zone.
content.location: This is around the right hand side of the Top Heavy Boulder.

content.description: Top Heavy is a nice, pedestal style boulder with a couple cool problems using the clean, open handed, heavy left arete. There is potential for another line going straight up the right face of the boulder.
